docs.text:
How Smart can you Hack with Spark


Download the Data Set


First 
login to your Spark VM
.


From within your Spark VM enter the following into the terminal:


cd /Data
wget --content-disposition bit.ly/BostonHackData
unzip Boston-Hackathon-May-28.zip




Next you'll likely want to 
load your data into HDFS
docs.title: First Steps
How Smart can you Hack with Spark

docs.text:
First  login to your Spark VM .  From within your Spark VM enter the following into the terminal:  cd /Data
wget --content-disposition bit.ly/BostonHackData
unzip Boston-Hackathon-May-28.zip  Next you'll likely want to  load your data into HDFS
docs.title: Download the Data Set

docs.text:
Overview


Every team will get their own Analytics Environment, which they will use to analyze data with Spark. Your Analytics Environment is comprised of the following cloud services:




Upload/Download service - Get files from your personal computers to the cloud


Spark Virtual Machine - Run spark jobs




Requesting your Environment


Each team will get a single Analytics Environment. 
Team leaders
 should request the environment 
here
.


Using your Environment


Accessing your Spark VM




As the 
Team Leader
 log in to the 
IM Demo Cloud
 and go to your project page.


Follow the instructions to SSH into your Spark VM.


From within your Spark VM you can run shell commands such as 
pyspark
, 
spark-shell
, and 
hdfs




Uploading code and data to your Spark VM






As the 
Team Leader
 log in to the 
IM Demo Cloud
 and go to your project page.


Click the "Uploads/Downloads" link, 
this will open up a new tab in your browser


Upload your files to your Spark server using the Upload/Download page.


As soon as the process completes, you should be able to access your files on your Spark VM in the 
/uploads
 directory.




Alternatively you can use the 
wget
 command from within your Spark VM to get files from external websites or servers.


Downloading files from your Spark VM to your personal computer




From the Spark VM, move any files you want to down to the 
/uploads
 directory.


As the 
Team Leader
 log in to the 
IM Demo Cloud
 and go to your project page.


Click the "Uploads/Downloads" link, 
this will open up a new tab in your browser


You should see the files you moved from 
Step 1
 in the file listing. Simply click the file to download.




Loading




As the 
Team Leader
 log in to the 
IM Demo Cloud
 and go to your project page.


Follow the instructions to SSH into your Spark VM.


From within your Spark VM you can run shell commands such as 
pyspark
, 
spark-shell
, and 
hdfs

monitisque transcribere tunc. Fumantia colla possim, cupidine vota maxime meus

properata poenae
.

; Ide nemus vices.

dolisque, videbor prior artus multorum dextra parvis veni virum undis ursos;

operisque

indignamque cornu. Lassatis talia Mavors diuque manibusque turbae omnia dicta se
rasa Ceyca finita huius 
relinque possunt
 est forma; nec
iustissime.
